storage.name: AccountNonce
docs: Extrinsics nonce for accounts.

storage.name: ExtrinsicCount
docs: Total extrinsics count for the current block.

storage.name: AllExtrinsicsLen
docs: Total length in bytes for all extrinsics put together, for the current block.

storage.name: BlockHash
docs: Map of block numbers to block hashes.

storage.name: ExtrinsicData
docs: Extrinsics data for the current block (maps extrinsic's index to its data).

storage.name: RandomSeed
docs: Random seed of the current block.

storage.name: Number
docs: The current block number being processed. Set by `execute_block`.

storage.name: ParentHash
docs: Hash of the previous block.

storage.name: ExtrinsicsRoot
docs: Extrinsics root of the current block, also part of the block header.

storage.name: Digest
docs: Digest of the current block, also part of the block header.

storage.name: Events
docs: Events deposited for the current block.

events.name: ExtrinsicSuccess
docs: An extrinsic completed successfully.

events.name: ExtrinsicFailed
docs: An extrinsic failed.

storage.name: Now
docs: Current time for the current block.

storage.name: BlockPeriod
docs: Old storage item provided for compatibility. Remove after all networks upgraded.

storage.name: MinimumPeriod
docs: The minimum period between blocks. Beware that this is different to the *expected* period
that the block production apparatus provides. Your chosen consensus system will generally
work with this to determine a sensible block time. e.g. For Aura, it will be double this
period on default settings.

storage.name: DidUpdate
docs: Did the timestamp get updated in this block?

calls.name: set
docs: Set the current time.
This call should be invoked exactly once per block. It will panic at the finalization phase,
if this call hasn't been invoked by that time.
The timestamp should be greater than the previous one by the amount specified by `minimum_period`.
The dispatch origin for this call must be `Inherent`.

calls.name: report_misbehavior
docs: Report some misbehavior.

calls.name: note_offline
docs: Note the previous block's validator missed their opportunity to propose a block.

calls.name: remark
docs: Make some on-chain remark.

calls.name: set_heap_pages
docs: Set the number of pages in the WebAssembly environment's heap.

calls.name: set_code
docs: Set the new code.

calls.name: set_storage
docs: Set some items of storage.

calls.name: kill_storage
docs: Kill some items from storage.

storage.name: NextEnumSet
docs: The next free enumeration set.

storage.name: EnumSet
docs: The enumeration sets.

events.name: NewAccountIndex
docs: A new account index was assigned.
This event is not triggered when an existing index is reassigned
to another `AccountId`.

storage.name: TotalIssuance
docs: The total units issued in the system.

storage.name: ExistentialDeposit
docs: The minimum amount required to keep an account open.

storage.name: TransferFee
docs: The fee required to make a transfer.

storage.name: CreationFee
docs: The fee required to create an account.

storage.name: TransactionBaseFee
docs: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the base.

storage.name: TransactionByteFee
docs: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the per-byte portion.

storage.name: Vesting
docs: Information regarding the vesting of a given account.

storage.name: FreeBalance
docs: The 'free' balance of a given account.
This is the only balance that matters in terms of most operations on tokens. It
alone is used to determine the balance when in the contract execution environment. When this
balance falls below the value of `ExistentialDeposit`, then the 'current account' is
deleted: specifically `FreeBalance`. Further, the `OnFreeBalanceZero` callback
is invoked, giving a chance to external modules to clean up data associated with
the deleted account.
`system::AccountNonce` is also deleted if `ReservedBalance` is also zero (it also gets
collapsed to zero if it ever becomes less than `ExistentialDeposit`.

storage.name: ReservedBalance
docs: The amount of the balance of a given account that is externally reserved; this can still get
slashed, but gets slashed last of all.
This balance is a 'reserve' balance that other subsystems use in order to set aside tokens
that are still 'owned' by the account holder, but which are suspendable.
When this balance falls below the value of `ExistentialDeposit`, then this 'reserve account'
is deleted: specifically, `ReservedBalance`.
`system::AccountNonce` is also deleted if `FreeBalance` is also zero (it also gets
collapsed to zero if it ever becomes less than `ExistentialDeposit`.)

storage.name: Locks
docs: Any liquidity locks on some account balances.

calls.name: transfer
docs: Transfer some liquid free balance to another account.
`transfer` will set the `FreeBalance` of the sender and receiver.
It will decrease the total issuance of the system by the `TransferFee`.
If the sender's account is below the existential deposit as a result
of the transfer, the account will be reaped.
The dispatch origin for this call must be `Signed` by the transactor.

calls.name: set_balance
docs: Set the balances of a given account.
This will alter `FreeBalance` and `ReservedBalance` in storage.
If the new free or reserved balance is below the existential deposit,
it will also decrease the total issuance of the system (`TotalIssuance`)
and reset the account nonce (`system::AccountNonce`).
The dispatch origin for this call is `root`.

events.name: NewAccount
docs: A new account was created.

events.name: ReapedAccount
docs: An account was reaped.

events.name: Transfer
docs: Transfer succeeded (from, to, value, fees).

storage.name: Validators
docs: The current set of validators.

storage.name: SessionLength
docs: Current length of the session.

storage.name: CurrentIndex
docs: Current index of the session.

storage.name: CurrentStart
docs: Timestamp when current session started.

storage.name: ForcingNewSession
docs: New session is being forced is this entry exists; in which case, the boolean value is whether
the new session should be considered a normal rotation (rewardable) or exceptional (slashable).

storage.name: LastLengthChange
docs: Block at which the session length last changed.

storage.name: NextKeyFor
docs: The next key for a given validator.

storage.name: NextSessionLength
docs: The next session length.

calls.name: set_key
docs: Sets the session key of `_validator` to `_key`. This doesn't take effect until the next
session.

calls.name: set_length
docs: Set a new session length. Won't kick in until the next session change (at current length).

calls.name: force_new_session
docs: Forces a new session.

events.name: NewSession
docs: New session has happened. Note that the argument is the session index, not the block
number as the type might suggest.

storage.name: ValidatorCount
docs: The ideal number of staking participants.

storage.name: MinimumValidatorCount
docs: Minimum number of staking participants before emergency conditions are imposed.

storage.name: SessionsPerEra
docs: The length of a staking era in sessions.

storage.name: SessionReward
docs: Maximum reward, per validator, that is provided per acceptable session.

storage.name: OfflineSlash
docs: Slash, per validator that is taken for the first time they are found to be offline.

storage.name: OfflineSlashGrace
docs: Number of instances of offline reports before slashing begins for validators.

storage.name: BondingDuration
docs: The length of the bonding duration in blocks.

storage.name: Invulnerables
docs: Any validators that may never be slashed or forcibly kicked. It's a Vec since they're easy to initialize
and the performance hit is minimal (we expect no more than four invulnerables) and restricted to testnets.

storage.name: Bonded
docs: Map from all locked "stash" accounts to the controller account.

storage.name: Ledger
docs: Map from all (unlocked) "controller" accounts to the info regarding the staking.

storage.name: Payee
docs: Where the reward payment should be made. Keyed by stash.

storage.name: Validators
docs: The map from (wannabe) validator stash key to the preferences of that validator.

storage.name: Nominators
docs: The map from nominator stash key to the set of stash keys of all validators to nominate.

storage.name: Stakers
docs: Nominators for a particular account that is in action right now. You can't iterate through validators here,
but you can find them in the `sessions` module.
This is keyed by the stash account.

storage.name: CurrentElected
docs: The currently elected validator set keyed by stash account ID.

storage.name: CurrentEra
docs: The current era index.

storage.name: CurrentSessionReward
docs: Maximum reward, per validator, that is provided per acceptable session.

storage.name: CurrentEraReward
docs: The accumulated reward for the current era. Reset to zero at the beginning of the era and
increased for every successfully finished session.

storage.name: NextSessionsPerEra
docs: The next value of sessions per era.

storage.name: LastEraLengthChange
docs: The session index at which the era length last changed.

storage.name: SlotStake
docs: The amount of balance actively at stake for each validator slot, currently.
This is used to derive rewards and punishments.

storage.name: SlashCount
docs: The number of times a given validator has been reported offline. This gets decremented by one each era that passes.

storage.name: ForcingNewEra
docs: We are forcing a new era.

storage.name: RecentlyOffline
docs: Most recent `RECENT_OFFLINE_COUNT` instances. (who it was, when it was reported, how many instances they were offline for).

calls.name: bond
docs: Take the origin account as a stash and lock up `value` of its balance. `controller` will be the
account that controls it.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_.

calls.name: bond_extra
docs: Add some extra amount that have appeared in the stash `free_balance` into the balance up for
staking.
Use this if there are additional funds in your stash account that you wish to bond.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the stash, not the controller.

calls.name: unbond
docs: Schedule a portion of the stash to be unlocked ready for transfer out after the bond
period ends. If this leaves an amount actively bonded less than
T::Currency::existential_deposit(), then it is increased to the full amount.
Once the unlock period is done, you can call `withdraw_unbonded` to actually move
the funds out of management ready for transfer.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.
See also [`Call::withdraw_unbonded`].

calls.name: withdraw_unbonded
docs: Remove any unlocked chunks from the `unlocking` queue from our management.
This essentially frees up that balance to be used by the stash account to do
whatever it wants.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.
See also [`Call::unbond`].

calls.name: validate
docs: Declare the desire to validate for the origin controller.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.

calls.name: nominate
docs: Declare the desire to nominate `targets` for the origin controller.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.

calls.name: chill
docs: Declare no desire to either validate or nominate.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.

calls.name: set_payee
docs: (Re-)set the payment target for a controller.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.

calls.name: set_controller
docs: (Re-)set the payment target for a controller.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the stash, not the controller.

calls.name: set_sessions_per_era
docs: Set the number of sessions in an era.

calls.name: set_bonding_duration
docs: The length of the bonding duration in eras.

calls.name: set_validator_count
docs: The ideal number of validators.

calls.name: force_new_era
docs: Force there to be a new era. This also forces a new session immediately after.
`apply_rewards` should be true for validators to get the session reward.

calls.name: set_offline_slash_grace
docs: Set the offline slash grace period.

calls.name: set_invulnerables
docs: Set the validators who cannot be slashed (if any).

events.name: Reward
docs: All validators have been rewarded by the given balance.

events.name: OfflineWarning
docs: One validator (and their nominators) has been given a offline-warning (they're still
within their grace). The accrued number of slashes is recorded, too.

events.name: OfflineSlash
docs: One validator (and their nominators) has been slashed by the given amount.

storage.name: PublicPropCount
docs: The number of (public) proposals that have been made so far.

storage.name: PublicProps
docs: The public proposals. Unsorted.

storage.name: DepositOf
docs: Those who have locked a deposit.

storage.name: LaunchPeriod
docs: How often (in blocks) new public referenda are launched.

storage.name: MinimumDeposit
docs: The minimum amount to be used as a deposit for a public referendum proposal.

storage.name: PublicDelay
docs: The delay before enactment for all public referenda.

storage.name: MaxLockPeriods
docs: The maximum number of additional lock periods a voter may offer to strengthen their vote. Multiples of `PublicDelay`.

storage.name: VotingPeriod
docs: How often (in blocks) to check for new votes.

storage.name: ReferendumCount
docs: The next free referendum index, aka the number of referendums started so far.

storage.name: NextTally
docs: The next referendum index that should be tallied.

storage.name: ReferendumInfoOf
docs: Information concerning any given referendum.

storage.name: DispatchQueue
docs: Queue of successful referenda to be dispatched.

storage.name: VotersFor
docs: Get the voters for the current proposal.

storage.name: VoteOf
docs: Get the vote in a given referendum of a particular voter. The result is meaningful only if `voters_for` includes the
voter when called with the referendum (you'll get the default `Vote` value otherwise). If you don't want to check
`voters_for`, then you can also check for simple existence with `VoteOf::exists` first.

storage.name: Delegations
docs: Get the account (and lock periods) to which another account is delegating vote.

calls.name: propose
docs: Propose a sensitive action to be taken.

calls.name: second
docs: Propose a sensitive action to be taken.

calls.name: vote
docs: Vote in a referendum. If `vote.is_aye()`, the vote is to enact the proposal;
otherwise it is a vote to keep the status quo.

calls.name: start_referendum
docs: Start a referendum.

calls.name: cancel_referendum
docs: Remove a referendum.

calls.name: cancel_queued
docs: Cancel a proposal queued for enactment.

calls.name: delegate
docs: Delegate vote.

calls.name: undelegate
docs: Undelegate vote.

storage.name: CandidacyBond
docs: How much should be locked up in order to submit one's candidacy.

storage.name: VotingBond
docs: How much should be locked up in order to be able to submit votes.

storage.name: PresentSlashPerVoter
docs: The punishment, per voter, if you provide an invalid presentation.

storage.name: CarryCount
docs: How many runners-up should have their approvals persist until the next vote.

storage.name: PresentationDuration
docs: How long to give each top candidate to present themselves after the vote ends.

storage.name: InactiveGracePeriod
docs: How many vote indexes need to go by after a target voter's last vote before they can be reaped if their
approvals are moot.

storage.name: VotingPeriod
docs: How often (in blocks) to check for new votes.

storage.name: TermDuration
docs: How long each position is active for.

storage.name: DesiredSeats
docs: Number of accounts that should be sitting on the council.

storage.name: ActiveCouncil
docs: The current council. When there's a vote going on, this should still be used for executive
matters. The block number (second element in the tuple) is the block that their position is
active until (calculated by the sum of the block number when the council member was elected
and their term duration).

storage.name: VoteCount
docs: The total number of votes that have happened or are in progress.

storage.name: ApprovalsOf
docs: A list of votes for each voter, respecting the last cleared vote index that this voter was
last active at.

storage.name: RegisterInfoOf
docs: The vote index and list slot that the candidate `who` was registered or `None` if they are not
currently registered.

storage.name: LastActiveOf
docs: The last cleared vote index that this voter was last active at.

storage.name: Voters
docs: The present voter list.

storage.name: Candidates
docs: The present candidate list.

storage.name: NextFinalize
docs: The accounts holding the seats that will become free on the next tally.

storage.name: SnapshotedStakes
docs: The stakes as they were at the point that the vote ended.

storage.name: Leaderboard
docs: Get the leaderboard if we;re in the presentation phase.

calls.name: set_approvals
docs: Set candidate approvals. Approval slots stay valid as long as candidates in those slots
are registered.

calls.name: reap_inactive_voter
docs: Remove a voter. For it not to be a bond-consuming no-op, all approved candidate indices
must now be either unregistered or registered to a candidate that registered the slot after
the voter gave their last approval set.
May be called by anyone. Returns the voter deposit to `signed`.

calls.name: retract_voter
docs: Remove a voter. All votes are cancelled and the voter deposit is returned.

calls.name: submit_candidacy
docs: Submit oneself for candidacy.
Account must have enough transferrable funds in it to pay the bond.

calls.name: present_winner
docs: Claim that `signed` is one of the top Self::carry_count() + current_vote().1 candidates.
Only works if the `block_number >= current_vote().0` and `< current_vote().0 + presentation_duration()``
`signed` should have at least

calls.name: set_desired_seats
docs: Set the desired member count; if lower than the current count, then seats will not be up
election when they expire. If more, then a new vote will be started if one is not already
in progress.

calls.name: remove_member
docs: Remove a particular member. A tally will happen instantly (if not already in a presentation
period) to fill the seat if removal means that the desired members are not met.
This is effective immediately.

calls.name: set_presentation_duration
docs: Set the presentation duration. If there is currently a vote being presented for, will
invoke `finalize_vote`.

calls.name: set_term_duration
docs: Set the presentation duration. If there is current a vote being presented for, will
invoke `finalize_vote`.

events.name: VoterReaped
docs: reaped voter, reaper

events.name: BadReaperSlashed
docs: slashed reaper

events.name: TallyStarted
docs: A tally (for approval votes of council seat(s)) has started.

events.name: TallyFinalized
docs: A tally (for approval votes of council seat(s)) has ended (with one or more new members).

storage.name: EnactDelayPeriod
docs: Number of blocks by which to delay enactment of successful, non-unanimous-council-instigated referendum proposals.

events.name: TallyCancelation
docs: A voting tally has happened for a referendum cancellation vote.
Last three are yes, no, abstain counts.

events.name: TallyReferendum
docs: A voting tally has happened for a referendum vote.
Last three are yes, no, abstain counts.

storage.name: Proposals
docs: The (hashes of) the active proposals.

storage.name: ProposalOf
docs: Actual proposal for a given hash, if it's current.

storage.name: Voting
docs: Votes for a given proposal: (required_yes_votes, yes_voters, no_voters).

storage.name: ProposalCount
docs: Proposals so far.

events.name: Proposed
docs: A motion (given hash) has been proposed (by given account) with a threshold (given u32).

events.name: Voted
docs: A motion (given hash) has been voted on by given account, leaving
a tally (yes votes and no votes given as u32s respectively).

events.name: Approved
docs: A motion was approved by the required threshold.

events.name: Disapproved
docs: A motion was not approved by the required threshold.

events.name: Executed
docs: A motion was executed; `bool` is true if returned without error.

calls.name: final_hint
docs: Hint that the author of this block thinks the best finalized
block is the given number.

calls.name: report_misbehavior
docs: Report some misbehavior.

events.name: NewAuthorities
docs: New authority set has been applied.

storage.name: ProposalBond
docs: Proportion of funds that should be bonded in order to place a proposal. An accepted
proposal gets these back. A rejected proposal doesn't.

storage.name: ProposalBondMinimum
docs: Minimum amount of funds that should be placed in a deposit for making a proposal.

storage.name: SpendPeriod
docs: Period between successive spends.

storage.name: Burn
docs: Percentage of spare funds (if any) that are burnt per spend period.

storage.name: Pot
docs: Total funds available to this module for spending.

storage.name: ProposalCount
docs: Number of proposals that have been made.

storage.name: Proposals
docs: Proposals that have been made.

storage.name: Approvals
docs: Proposal indices that have been approved but not yet awarded.

calls.name: propose_spend
docs: Put forward a suggestion for spending. A deposit proportional to the value
is reserved and slashed if the proposal is rejected. It is returned once the
proposal is awarded.

calls.name: set_pot
docs: Set the balance of funds available to spend.

calls.name: configure
docs: (Re-)configure this module.

calls.name: reject_proposal
docs: Reject a proposed spend. The original deposit will be slashed.

calls.name: approve_proposal
docs: Approve a proposal. At a later time, the proposal will be allocated to the beneficiary
and the original deposit will be returned.

events.name: Proposed
docs: New proposal.

events.name: Spending
docs: We have ended a spend period and will now allocate funds.

events.name: Awarded
docs: Some funds have been allocated.

events.name: Burnt
docs: Some of our funds have been burnt.

events.name: Rollover
docs: Spending has finished; this is the amount that rolls over until next spend.

storage.name: TransferFee
docs: The fee required to make a transfer.

storage.name: CreationFee
docs: The fee required to create an account.

storage.name: TransactionBaseFee
docs: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the base.

storage.name: TransactionByteFee
docs: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the per-byte portion.

storage.name: ContractFee
docs: The fee required to create a contract instance.

storage.name: CallBaseFee
docs: The base fee charged for calling into a contract.

storage.name: CreateBaseFee
docs: The base fee charged for creating a contract.

storage.name: GasPrice
docs: The price of one unit of gas.

storage.name: MaxDepth
docs: The maximum nesting level of a call/create stack.

storage.name: BlockGasLimit
docs: The maximum amount of gas that could be expended per block.

storage.name: GasSpent
docs: Gas spent so far in this block.

storage.name: CurrentSchedule
docs: Current cost schedule for contracts.

storage.name: CodeHashOf
docs: The code associated with a given account.

storage.name: PristineCode
docs: A mapping from an original code hash to the original code, untouched by instrumentation.

storage.name: CodeStorage
docs: A mapping between an original code hash and instrumented wasm code, ready for the execution.

storage.name: AccountCounter
docs: The subtrie counter

storage.name: AccountInfoOf
docs: The code associated with a given account.

calls.name: update_schedule
docs: Updates the schedule for metering contracts.
The schedule must have a greater version than the stored schedule.

calls.name: put_code
docs: Stores the given binary Wasm code into the chains storage and returns its `codehash`.
You can instantiate contracts only with stored code.

calls.name: call
docs: Makes a call to an account, optionally transferring some balance.
* If the account is a smart-contract account, the associated code will be
executed and any value will be transferred.
* If the account is a regular account, any value will be transferred.
* If no account exists and the call value is not less than `existential_deposit`,
a regular account will be created and any value will be transferred.

calls.name: create
docs: Creates a new contract from the `codehash` generated by `put_code`, optionally transferring some balance.
Creation is executed as follows:
- the destination address is computed based on the sender and hash of the code.
- the smart-contract account is created at the computed address.
- the `ctor_code` is executed in the context of the newly created account. Buffer returned
after the execution is saved as the `code` of the account. That code will be invoked
upon any call received by this account.
- The contract is initialized.

events.name: Transfer
docs: Transfer happened `from` to `to` with given `value` as part of a `call` or `create`.

events.name: Instantiated
docs: Contract deployed by address at the specified address.

events.name: CodeStored
docs: Code with the specified hash has been stored.

events.name: ScheduleUpdated
docs: Triggered when the current schedule is updated.

events.name: Dispatched
docs: A call was dispatched from the given account. The bool signals whether it was
successful execution or not.

events.name: Sudid
docs: A sudo just took place.

events.name: KeyChanged
docs: The sudoer just switched identity; the old key is supplied.
